short-title.#text:
Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means the Fort Sumner Irrigation District, located
			 in De Baca County, New Mexico.

text.#text:
The
			 term

term.#tail:
means the
			 contract between the United States and the District for the forbearance of
			 exercising priority water rights numbered 08–WC–40–292 and dated August 21,
			 2009 (including any amendments to that contract).

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Fort Sumner reclamation project.

text.#text:
The
			 term

term.#tail:
means the
			 contract between the United States and the District numbered Ilr–1524 and dated
			 November 5, 1948 (including any supplements and amendments to that
			 contract).

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Secretary of the Interior.

text.#text:
The
			 term

quote.#tail:
and numbered 11–WC–40–406 (including any amendments to that
			 agreement).
quote.#text:
Memorandum of Agreement between the United States
			 and the Fort Sumner Irrigation District Concerning Principles and Elements of
			 Proposed Transfer of Title to Fort Sumner Irrigation District
			 Facilities

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:3/ss:d

term.#tail:
means the
			 agreement between the United States and the Fort Sumner Irrigation District
			 that identifies the specific terms and conditions of the title transfer. This
			 document will be completed after the requirements described in

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to convey to the District all
			 right and title of the United States in and to all works, land, and facilities
			 of the Project, in accordance with the terms and conditions established in the
			 Transfer Agreement.

text.#text: The

The conveyance under this section shall be subject to all
			 valid existing leases, permits, rights-of-way, easements, and other rights
			 appurtenant to the property conveyed.

The costs of the conveyance under this section,
			 including the costs of environmental compliance, may be shared between the
			 United States and the District, in accordance with the Memorandum of
			 Agreement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall assure compliance with all applicable requirements
			 under—

text.#text: Before carrying out the conveyance under
the
the

any other law
			 applicable to the property conveyed.

Nothing
			 in this Act modifies or alters any obligation under—
the
the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
fails to complete the conveyance under
			 this section by the date that is 2 years after the date of completion of the
			 requirements described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:3/ss:d

text.#text: If the

explains the
			 reasons why the conveyance has not been completed; and

states the date by
			 which the conveyance will be completed.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:3

text.#text: Effective on the date of the conveyance under

shall have no
			 further interest in, and shall have no responsibility for operating or
			 maintaining, the Project; and

shall not be
			 liable for damages of any kind arising out of any act, omission, or occurrence
			 relating to the conveyed property, except for damages caused by acts committed
			 by the United States or employees, agents, or contractors of the United States
			 before the date of the conveyance.

Nothing in this section increases the liability of the
			 United States beyond the liability provided under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
chapter 171 of title 28,
			 United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:3

text.#text:
Effective
			 beginning on the date of the conveyance under

the Repayment
			 Contract shall terminate; and

the United States
			 and the District shall have no obligations under the Repayment Contract.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the United States shall have no payment obligation
			 under paragraph 4(a) of the Forbearance Agreement.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:5

text.#text:
In accordance with paragraph 4(a) of the Forbearance
			 Agreement, effective beginning on the date of termination of the Repayment
			 Contract under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act/s:5

text.#text:
All other terms and conditions of the Forbearance
			 Agreement shall remain in full force and effect on termination of the Repayment
			 Contract under

The
			 term of the Forbearance Agreement shall be not less than 10 years after the
			 date of enactment of this Act, as set forth in the Memorandum of
			 Agreement.

After conveyance of
			 title under this Act—

the entity to
			 which the property is conveyed shall not be eligible to receive any benefits,
			 including Federal project power, with respect to the conveyed property, except
			 for benefits that would be available to a similarly situated entity with
			 respect to property that is not part of a Federal reclamation project.

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To transfer certain facilities, easements, and
		  rights-of-way to Fort Sumner Irrigation District, New Mexico.

Committee on Energy and Natural
